org.netbeans.modules.java.hints.test.api

Class HintTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.modules.java.hints.test.api.HintTest

  • public class HintTest
extends Object
    A support class for writing a test for a Java Hint. A test verifying that correct warnings are produced should look like: 
     HintTest.create()
         .input("<input Java source code>")
         .run(<class containg the hint>)
         .assertWarnings("<required warning(s)>");
    Note: when verifying that no warnings are produced in a particular situation, do not pass any warnings to the assertWarnings method. A test verifying that a hint's transformation is correct: 
     HintTest.create()
         .input("<input Java source code>")
         .run(<class containg the hint>)
         .findWarning("<a warning produce by the hint>")
         .applyFix() //fill apply the only fix in the given ErrorDescription
         .assertCompilable()
         .assertOutput("<output Java source code>");
    All the tests run under the test branding, which allows to specify test values for bundle keys for warning and fix in Bundle_test.properties, to isolate the test from changes in the production Bundle.properties.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      • create

        public static HintTest create()
                       throws Exception
        Bootstraps the test framework.
        Returns:
        the test framework - call more methods on it to set-up a test, then call run method and assert results.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • setCaretMarker

        public HintTest setCaretMarker(char c)
        A character to use as a marker of a caret in the input code. The caret position during the run method will be set to the position of this character in the first input file.
        Parameters:
        c - a caret marker
        Returns:
        itself

      • classpath

        public HintTest classpath(URL... entries)
        Use the specified URLs as compile classpath while parsing the Java input. The URLs need to be "folder" URLs, ready to be passed to ClassPathSupport.createClassPath(java.net.URL[]).
        Parameters:
        entries - that should become roots of the compile classpath
        Returns:
        itself
        See Also:
        FileUtil.urlForArchiveOrDir(java.io.File), FileUtil.getArchiveRoot(java.net.URL)

        public HintTest input(String code,
                      boolean compilable)
               throws Exception
        Create a test file. Equivalent to calling input("test/Test.java", code, compilable).
        Parameters:
        code - the content of the newly created test file
        compilable - if true, it will be verified that the file does not contain compilation errors before the hint is run on it

      • input

        public HintTest input(String fileName,
                      String code,
                      boolean compilable)
               throws Exception
        Create a test file. Any number of files can be created for one test, but the hint will be run only on the first one.
        Parameters:
        fileName - a relative file name of the newly created file from a (automatically created) source root
        code - the content of the newly created test file
        compilable - if true, it will be verified that the file does not contain compilation errors before the hint is run on it
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        Exception

      • run

        public HintTest.HintOutput run(Class<?> hint)
                        throws Exception
        Runs the given hint(s) on the first file written by a input method.
        Parameters:
        hint - all hints in this class will be run on the file
        Returns:
        a wrapper over the hint output that allows verifying results of the hint
        Throws:
        Exception

      • run

        public HintTest.HintOutput run(Class<?> hint,
                               String hintCode)
                        throws Exception
        Runs the given hint(s) on the first file written by a input method. Runs only hints with the specified hintCode. Null hintCode includes all hints from the class
        Parameters:
        hint - all hints in this class will be run on the file
        hintCode - if not null, only hints with the same id will be run
        Returns:
        a wrapper over the hint output that allows verifying results of the hint
        Throws:
        Exception
